title: High usage vs high efficiency: Which matters more?

hook.text:
LeBron or Curry? Westbrook or Jokić? The eternal debate.

[On-screen: "VOLUME VS EFFICIENCY ⚔️"]

Here's what the math actually says...

explanation.text:
TUSG% = Volume (how much you dominate the ball)
PVR = Efficiency (how well you use each possession)

[Show quadrant chart]

Top right = High usage + High efficiency (MVP tier)
Top left = High efficiency, low usage (role player/system player)
Bottom right = High usage, low efficiency (volume scorer)
Bottom left = You're getting traded.

The BEST players? Both high. Curry 2016: 36.9 TUSG + 40.3 PVR.

example.text:
Compare:
- Harden 2019: 45.7 TUSG, 18.6 PVR (elite volume, good efficiency)
- Jokić 2022: 33.7 TUSG, 44.5 PVR (good volume, ELITE efficiency)

[Show: Both won MVP - different paths]

Both won MVP. Math says: either path works if you're elite.

cta.text:
Want to plot your favorite player? Link in bio. Follow for daily NBA analytics.

[End screen: "BOTH MATTER ⚖️"]

trending_sounds: original sound (use trending audio from FYP)
